Reviews.Content: Bad outweighed the good... We had 10 days booked at this hotel. Our first 4 days were Fantastic! We then went on a 4-day road trip leaving most of our luggage and souvenirs in the room. We informed the Hotel of our time away. When we returned for a relaxing final 2 days, we discovered that our room had been used in our absence. A full bucket of unmelted ice was the first clue, as was the radio and TV on. We aren't sure if our belongings were touched, so on that I won't comment.I will say that we were Very happy with the Hotel until we returned from our road trip. A four-star Hotel should NOT use a pre-booked, pre-paid room for ANY reason.The staff and manager tried to deal with this as best they could, but it should Never have happened. This Hotel has many admirable qualities but, for our stay, the bad outweighed the good.
Reviews.Author: dfx

Reviews.Content: great choice! The room on the 15th floor overlooking Chapultepec Park was great for our family of 4...spacious, clean, wireless internet, great park view, decent workout room, helpful staff in the business center, etc. A bit of a walk to eat, but we like that. The concierge service was exceptional. Advice on restaurants, tours, etc. Kudos to Alberto who, after I had a nightmare of an experience with ADVANTAGE rent-a-car at the Mex City airport, was able to email me a receipt that I needed to verify an expense within about 15 minutes of my request. EXCEPTIONAL service!
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTucson

Reviews.Content: Good News, Bad News       The view from my room.
Reviews.Author: Fotobaron

Reviews.Content: Mixed Feelings First, the positives. A clean and spacious room with a stunning view of Chapultepec castle. Very friendly staff. Convenient to Chapultepec Park and its various attractions. A decent fitness center, with a 19th floor view, no less.But there are definite negatives. The location is not convenient to anything except the park. It's an uncomfortably long and complicated walk to decent restaurants or cafes, and the closest metro stop (Chapultepec) is a circuitous ten minute hike. For me, though, the biggest negatives were the outrageous prices for everything beyond the room itself. Internet access? That will be $25 per day. I'm not kidding - $25 dollars per day! Want to use the locker room after you work out in the fitness center? That will be another $12.50. A 200 ml bottle of water from the mini-bar? That will set you back over four dollars. For like three good size sips of water. (And while the maid is supposed to leave a carafe of agua purificada in the room, mine never did. Good thing there's a 7-11 two blocks away.)They are clearly aiming for the corporate expense account here (Torre Major is close by). But I would rather have the expenses built into the room rate right up front rather than feeling nickeled and dimed to death. It's enough to keep me from coming back.
Reviews.Author: acek

Reviews.Content: A good choice in Mexico City We stayed here for six nights on Easter Week. This hotel is the top property of the Fiesta Americana chain in Mexico City. It is located a half block from the Reforma Avenue, accross the street from Chapultepec Park, and equidistant from the Zona Rosa and fashionable Polanco neighborhoods. It's high points are the excellent service from all the staff, well appointed rooms with excellent views of Emperor Maximilian's Castle in the Park, beautiful marble bathrooms, and the possibility of walking to the Anthropology Museum, the Modern Arts Museum, the Tamayo Museum, and the Zoo (take the kids to look at the thriving Panda family). There is only one Restaurant, which has an adequate breakfast. We did not try it for other meals. There are two convenience stores two blocks behind the hotel. One should also make a point of visiting the nearby hotel Camino Real, a modern architectural gem, and a great place to go for breakfast.
Reviews.Author: catador

Reviews.Content: Extremely Poor Service I would like to complain about the extremely poor service my family (2 adults and 2 children) received upon arriving at the hotel, after booking a room in the Fiesta Americana Grand Chapultepec on-line and having the reservation confirmed by Credit Card. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 7pm to find that the room we had booked with two double beds was not available. The receptionist told us that we would have to take a room with 1 King size bed and that there was no extra rollaway beds available. This would mean that 4 of us would have to sleep in one King Size bed which was totally unacceptable. We then talked to the manager and he said he would give us a suite at no extra cost but again this would only have 1 King size bed with no additional beds available. If we wanted two rooms which is the only way we could have sufficient beds, we would have to pay for the second one. I was extremely disappointed with the way this was handled and the manager was completely unhelpful and did not care that he had overbooked the hotel by allowing guests to stay longer than their original bookings (which was the reason the receptionist gave us initially to justify why our room was not available). This should have only been allowed if they had rooms available. We were in a strange city and then had to find another hotel at the last minute with two very tired children. I have never had such poor customer service from a hotel before and this would make me think twice before booking with this chain of hotels again.
Reviews.Author: Aussie-in-Mexico

Reviews.Content: Exceptional service, even to a non-guest. I just returned from Mexico city where I stayed at this hotel and was totally pleased with the sevrice. I arrived late at noght by and by the time I recived my reciept from the taxi, the porter had already noted my name from my bags. After the 10 second walk to the front desk, the attendant already had my reservaiton pulled and ready for my review. The room was excellent but I did not spend enough time there to truly enjoy it.Two days later I was retuning to Mexico City and had my secretary make a last minute reservation. She failed to guanantee it with a credit card. When I arrived at 10:30, the manager advised me very professionally that the reservation had been cancelled and no rooms were available. Within 1 minute, he made a booking for me a the Marquis Reforma at the same rate as my Fiesta rate. The porter collected my bags, drove me to the Marquis and accompanied me inside to make sure all was well. While I truly enjoyed the Marquis which is a great hotel, I will more likely return to teh Fiesta Inn beacuse of how well they took care of me when I was not a guest!.
Reviews.Author: GPSatHome

Reviews.Content: Pleasant but expensive Stayed here in late September for my wife's birthday. The concierge (Arturo) helped plan a surprise for her, by having the room filled with ballons, flowers and a cake. It was awesome and he did a great job. I can't say enough nice things about all the staff, and the concierge in particular.However, the hotel is in truth, just nice. It's kind of Marriottesque. Safe, clean and comfortable without really engaging your senses in any way. The minibar and room service were very very expensive too which was a let down for Mexico. So, overall, it's a nice place to be, without really being amazing in any one sense.
Reviews.Author: HoustonLawyer

Reviews.Content: Excellent return stay I discovered this hotel on Expedia in January, and since then I have returned about six times to this hotel. I do continue to book through Expedia, because the rates are considerably discounted. Service: excellent in all areas of the hotel. Business facilities: good wireless and LAN connections in each room. Good business center facilities for copying or printing. Meeting rooms are also available in the business center. Gym/spa: very good, small gym with treadmills, bicycles, stair stepper, and weights. Great view of the Chapultepec castle from the gym. No fee for guests. The gym is located right next to the spa, which offers massages and other spa services. For a fee, guests can use the locker room, which has both a steam room and sauna. There is also a hot tub in the spa area. Dining: room service is good. The menu is kind of limited, but if you get tired of the options, there is a Camino Real within three blocks that has a variety of restaurants. And if you want even more variety, the La Condesa neighborhood is very close by, with a variety of restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel for business travelers or even tourists. The Chapultepec park is just right across the street, and the museum of anthropology is within walking distance, as are other art museums within the park. When reserving, or checking in, see if you can get a room with a view of the Chapultepec castle. Some of the rooms have a great view.
Reviews.Author: HollyWorton

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel; Good location Stayed here or 1 night in March. A very nice hotel located at the edge of the park. There is not too many restaurants within walking distace of the hotel. Rooms were very large and looked newly renovated. Used the health club at the top of th ehotel and it was not large but had good facilities. A minus however that they wanted to chargeme to use the jacuzzi. All in all a good business hotel.
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaCharlesW

Reviews.Content: Very pleasing visit to Mexico City My first business trip to Mexico City, April 2-5. A colleague had recommended the Fiesta Americana and I was not at all disappointed. I had a junior suite that over looked Chapultepec Park. The room was clean, quiet and very confortable. I found the staff to be very helpful and eager to please. The hotel was within walking distance of all of the great restaurants and shops in Polanco. Most importantly I felt safe at all times. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there any time I return to Mexico City.
Reviews.Author: rlbmkg

Reviews.Content: A Great Hotel in Ideal Location We picked this hotel because of its location and great value. It is a short walk from the Museums of Anthropology and Modern Art, both great sites. Also, the Turibus stop is across the street, one block away. The accomodations were wonderful: clean, spacious, comfortable rooms; health spa; well equiped business center. A surprise was the great restaurant: apparently it has improved greatly since previous reviewers. We had both breakfast and dinner there, and the food and service were excellent. There is a nice wine selection and extensive variety of tequillas. We will definitely consider it when we return to Mexico City.
Reviews.Author: neunepacan

Reviews.Content: They robbed me in my room Terrible experience. They robbed me a pair of trousers. They promised to pay it to me but they have not done it. They treated to me very badly.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel at a great price... This is a wonderful hotel - truely a 4 star hotel in a really good area of Mexico City. The staff was very helpful, the rooms where spacious and very clean with great views. The gym, located on the top floor was much more than we expected. The restaurant was very good as well, a bit pricey but not as bad as other hotels in the area. Anyone traveling to Mexico City should seriously consider this hotel. We booked through the quick check price comparison on tripadvisor.com and got a really good deal.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Will surely go back to this hotel. This was a fafulous two day-stay. Room was excellent, with a magnificent view. Staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. Food and service was first quality. Quiet, great to relax: I will definitively visit this hotel again.As a bonus, we took a walk in the mornings in the best place of Mexico City: Bosque de Chapultepec. View from the room:incomparable.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great location, so-so restaurant This is a beautiful hotel - but much smaller than I thought it would be from images on the internet. The rooms were small to average sized, but nicely appointed. We didn't speak much Spanish, and there was always someone on hand to help us in English, which we really appreciated. We stayed there one night at the beginning of our trip and one night at the end of the trip. We walked across the street to Chapultepec Park and also visited the Museum of Anthropology. The location was excellent, and our room had views of Chapultepec Castle. The desk staff also helped us arrange a tour to Teotihuacon which was wonderful. On our return trip we were bumped up to a concierge level room (not sure how we rated) and it was even nicer. The concierge level had turn down service, robe and slippers, an exercise bike, a suit valet, and a nicer bathroom. Also on this level, you have the option of using the executive lounge on the 16th floor where there is a free continental breakfast in the morning and cookies and drinks in the afternoon.We ate in the one of the restaurants, but found did not find it to our liking. It was quite expensive, and the food was very rich - an international menu, not local. You don't particularly feel like you are in Mexico in this hotel. The other restaurant choice was a sushi restaurant. We ordered room service on our last night and the service was excellent and the surcharge for room service wasn't bad.I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay close to Chapultepec Park in a safe and elegant hotel. Excellent for foreigners who do not speak much Spanish.
Reviews.Author: chardob

Reviews.Content: Eso no es Grand My team and I stayed there on business off and on for weeks soley because of a relationship between my company and Posada. With one notable exception, the entire staff was incompetent and seemingly new to the hospitality industry. Stay elsewhere. Eat elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loved the Fiesta Americana Grand Chapultepec This hotel is amazing. The rooms on the executive floor are lovely, albeit somewhat small, are well-organized. The bathrooms are in marble with solid brass fixtures, marble showers and bathtubs. They give you gorgeous waffle-weave bathrobes and luxurious towels. The beds are covered with down comforters and the pillows are down-filled. The sheets are very high threadcount. The mattresses perfect. Room ambient lighting is relaxing and adequate for all purposes. The breakfast and happy hours on the executive levels are delicious. The concierge on the exec level was always overworked and you always had to wait, but they were friendly and tried very hard to please.I never could get the in-room internet to work on my corporate lapcomputer.Room service is fast and courteous. I lived in this hotel for 8 months and didn't want to leave! The only complaint I had was that their room service menu got boring, but I suppose that's normal after so much time in the same hotel.I give this 4 stars not 5 because the driveway and drop-off point of this hotel is too small for the amount of traffic the hotel receives, leading to long waits for your taxi in the morning or afternoon. Also, the food in the restaurants is good but not excellent. The menus are creative but didn't quite live up to my expectations.This hotel is listed as one of the Leading Hotels of the World. I also stayed at the JW Marriott but preferred the Fiesta Grand which is less stuffy and the rooms at the Grand are larger.
Reviews.Author: BrazilGringo

Reviews.Content: buyer beware I was extremely disappointed with this hotel. The price is very high for such poor quality and service. Beware of hidden charges. There are much nicer hotels in the area at comparable prices.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best night sleep in Mexico City, worst hotel restaurant The rooms are the most comfortable in the City at a relatively decent price. Down comforters, feather pillows, marble baths...top of the line service and very clean. The downfall would be eating facilities. One main restaurant, over-priced and not much to offer in terms of dishes. If it were not for the excellent service and the nice rooms, I would never return to the hotel; however, I spend up to 80 nights a year in Mexico City and it is the best night sleep I may find.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
